Nightshift ste=
ps forward to volunteer as a field tracker. Being a Ninja Bot he knew how t=
o track a bot and do it without being seen or heard.


" I got an idea, I c=
ould follow those coordinates and get real close ta finalize his location."=



Tucson clears his throat in a commanding manner.


" As soon as you find=
 him, inform me, I need to know if we have to take drastic security measure=
s.  I know he will try to lure Nightlight and Elita out of hiding and I am =
not about to let him get near them."


He holds a serious frown on his face=
.  Nothing would get past a steadfast guardian, especially one of his calib=
er.

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 19, 2011, at 5:3=
5 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:




  

> <OLD>
>
> N=
ightshift gives Wing Caliber the device to view on screen. He crosses his
>=
 fingers hoping that it did what he intended it to do.
>
> " Let's hope we =
got someth'n . I wasn't too close when I deployed it but
> within range for=
 it ta pick up Dark Rodimus's IFF. Even if that over rated
> hot rod gets h=
is tailpipes outa that mean phase of his, no way I'm gonna
> trust him anym=
ore. I seriously hope we can retrieve the Matrix and get it
> outa that bac=
kstabber before it's too late."

<NEW>

There is smile from WING CALIBER as=
 he takes the device and examines
it for a moment. Then with a nod he press=
es a few buttons and slides
it into the recieiving section of his computer =
console.

With a few deft movements he activates the final sequence of comm=
ands
and turns to look at the screen . . .

The screen is black, a single p=
hrase bouncing along the screen reading
'no signal'.

"Slag." LEO said out =
loud before he looked embarrased and glanced at
NIGHTLIGHT and ELITA. "I me=
ant . . . aw nuts! . . . What happened?"

WING SABER looked at the screen f=
or a moment confusion clearly on his
face. "The machine was clearly picking=
 up something it had a
location." he stepped back to the console as he mani=
pulated a few
other controls. "Let's see what it recorded."

The screen goe=
s from being black to a replay of the scene where DARK
RODIMUS was facing d=
own SCOURGE, the Sweeps, NIGHTSHIFT and STRAIGHT
SHOT. The screen got bigge=
r as the minicam approached DARK RODIMUS, in
the corner were cordinates ind=
icating where they were at the time.

Then the screen went black, presumabl=
y where DARK RODIMUS vanished
from sight and then the screen went black aga=
in.

"That didn't show us much." LEO said, clearly getting preturbed.

"Pat=
ience." WING CALIBER said as he carefully reran the scene in slow
motion. H=
e zipped back the point where DARK RODIMUS vanished and ran
it again slowly=
.

"Look!' WING CALIBER said as he pointed at the corner of the screen
that=
 showed coordinates.

In the corner the cordinates changed. One moment they=
 were showing the
cordinates of where the Dinosaurs had been and the stand =
off had
occured. Then for a micro second they showed something else, and th=
en
went blank.

"Rewind that." LEO said, his voice more interested this tim=
e.

The scene backed up second by second until if finally showed the new
co=
rdinate. "We GOT HIM!" LEO said as he smacked one fist into the
other.

"No=
t so fast." WING CALIBER said. "We only have a partial cordinate.
But we ca=
n now get close."

(TAG)
